result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Eric Nielsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Travis Eric Nielsen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Travis Eric Nielsen was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program

If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 19CF53

superMiscConds.notes:
- $268 Court Costs payable to Clerk of Court.  Reduced to Civil Judgment
- $250 DNA Surcharge payable to Clerk of Court.. Reduced to Civil Judgment

- DNA sample
- Eligible for any programming in the prison system
- Absolute sobriety
- programming as deemed appropriate by agent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis Eric Nielsen

records.addlTxt: ec: Attys, e: DOC, cc: SCSO, c: Issuing Agency, DE. bph
filed by Atty, signed by DE and Atty. bph
filed and signed by DE and Atty. bph   To ty

2:00 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Benoy   Defendant Travis Eric Nielsen in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Travis Eric Nielsen.  Attorney Aaron Damrau in court for State of Wisconsin.   Atty Dolfi states they wish to proceed to Plea/Sentencing today. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 2. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Cts 1, 3 & 4. Sentencing arguments. Statement by DE.

Crt orders: 
TS: 3 Years, 6 Months, IC 1 Year 6 Months to run concurrent to 19CF53, ES: 2 Years
 
-  58 days credit

-  Eligible for any programming in the prison system
-  Eligible for SAP
-  Challenge incarceration
-  Court costs of $268
-  DNA surcharge of $250
-  Costs reduced to a civil judgment

Conditions of extended supervision:
-   payment of court costs
-   absolute sobriety
-   programming as deemed appropriate by agent

10:06 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel.  Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court w/Travis Eric Nielsen, in custody. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Demands speedy trial. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned: 10:07 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

9:17 AM Court Commissioner: Tim Heckmann, Reporter: UNMONITORED DAR. Clerk: K Kittel.  ADA Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court w/Travis Eric Nielsen in court, in custody. S/T Officer Max Berger, Hudson PD; direct by Atty Rockow. Record reflects identity of the DE. Cross by Atty Dolfi. ADA Rockow argues bind over. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned: 9:26 am
Arraignment scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Filed by ADA Rockow. arc   e: Atty Dolfi

The original document was titled: Pretrial assessment
The original history event date is: 08-11-2022

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

1:42 PM CO: TCH , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow with Intern Ali Casey in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court. Defendant Travis Eric Nielsen in court, in custody. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE does qualify for PD. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Waives speedy prelim. Court sets PH. Adjourned
